contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Ranville |image = FranceNormandieRanvilleEgliseClocher.jpg |image coat of arms = 4 Blason des Guernon-Ranville.gif |region = Basse-Normandie |department = Calvados |arrondissement = Caen |canton = Cabourg |INSEE = 14530 |postal code = 14860 |mayor = Jean-Luc Adélaïde |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = Campagne et Baie de L'Orne |longitude = -0.2564 |latitude = 49.2319 |elevation m = 26 |elevation min m = 1 |elevation max m = 49 |area km2 = 8.42 |population = 1703 |population date = 2008 }} {{Expand French|date=December 2008|Ranville}} '''Ranville''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Calvados]] [[Departments of France|department]] in the [[Basse-Normandie]] [[Regions of France|region]] in northwestern [[France]]. Ranville was the first French village liberated on [[D-Day]]. The village was liberated by the British 13th Parachute Battalion, commanded by Lieutenant-Colonel Peter Luard. The ''château du Heaume'' in the village was subsequently used by the headquarters of the British 6th Airborne Division. The village features heavily in the book "13 - Lucky For Some" which is about the history of the 13th (Lancashire) Parachute Battalion.
